txt.en: Talk to Pippin
Follow the footprints
'DNT Blah!'
DNT - Blah!
DNT step forward

'This is near to the place Golodhon thought they should be. They are not standing out in plain view, at any rate! I suppose the only thing is to begin looking around for them, or signs of where they have gone.'
'DNT - hai hobbit!'

You have returned with Merry and Pippin to Mordor, with the sole intent of finding the three suspicious half-orcs. The ranger Golodhon has pointed you on the way to where he believes they ought to be.
Talk to Merry
You should begin searching the area for signs of the three half-orcs.
Stop to get your bearings
DNT go forward
Continue searching
Continue searching
You should continue searching the area for signs of the three half-orcs.
Begin searching
You should talk to Pippin and find out what he thinks he has seen.
Defeated enraged troll
'Just look what I've found. Over there, between those rocks. Boot marks -- and they're too soft and narrow to be Orc-feet, by my reckoning.\n\n'Come, let us see where they lead!'
Confront the half-orcs
You should follow the footprints that Pippin discovered and see where they lead.
Talk to the dying half-orc
'What is it, Pippin?'
Talk to Merry
DNT pippin says let's stop for a bit to eat
Talk to Pippin
You have found the three half-orcs again. Join Merry and Pippin and try to get some answers out of them.
DNT talk to merry
'Well, nevermind. Let's keep going.'
'Look sharp!'
'You three. Why, we have got words with you.'
DNT they enjoy a bit to eat
'If they have a bone of decency among the three of them, they will be standing upon a high rock again, talking loudly enough to hear and find them by.'
DNT approach the trio
'Ar har har! What's this, then? Halflings in Mordor?'
The prints lead ever onward and upward
'Well don't that beat all. All done up like menfolk, too.'
An enraged troll has stumbled into the confrontation, knocking down one of the half-orcs and sending the other two fleeing. You must defend yourself against the troll!
'I'm warning you. You will tell us about the pipeweed barrels in Isengard, and the Wizard, and what you meant about the halfling lands'
With that, the half-orc expires
DNT the hobbits are there, waiting for you
'Or you shall have a taste of our blades!'
You should resume searching the area for signs of the three half-orcs.
'Har! Or sell you three to the Red Eye, more like, along with the news we've got.'
'Look out!'
'A Troll!'
DNT interrogate the last one

'Bah! That's done me in, I know it. And you lot.  So you found some barrels in Isengard, did you? That isn't half of it. Ha ha. Ha ha ha ha....'

He devolves into pained coughing for several moments.

'There's plenty more where that came from, in your precious Shire. That land is good undefended, it is. Ripe for the plucking.'
You should talk to Pippin and Merry.
'Run away! Save yourself!'
'Aauugh!'

'Poor fellow. He will not be dearly missed by anyone, I suppose, not even his craven comrades. I cannot say that I am satisfied, but I think we have done all we could this day. It is time we headed back.'
'<cough> <cough> Ugh.....'
'I say, what's that there?'
'Those - those weren't answers. Those were riddles. Riddles that would drive even old Bilbo mad!'
'And look, there is a whole trail of them!'
DNT the footprints lead on
'You then, still breathing? Answer us. What about the pipeweed?'
The prints lead ever onward and upward
'Merry is right, of course. We are done with Mordor for now. Perhaps for good. Let us get going then, before anything else unpleasant can happen!'
'Oh, hobbit-kind is not so easily cowed, as your Wizard will find out the hard way. Oh, why if it isn't enough to -- to -- hrrrrrm....'
'Guhhhh...'
The prints lead ever onward and upward
The half-orc who was struck by the troll has some life yet in him. You should speak to him now and see what you can learn.
'Well, come on then. Don't just stand there!'
You have found the three half-orcs again!
'No sign of them here.'
DNT a troll comes barreling in!
'Nothing? Then we had better keep looking, I suppose.'
The prints lead ever onward and upward
'Look, you can see the Isenmouthe from here. Not a friendly sort of gate, is it?'
Merry has brought your expedition to a stop. You should hear what he has to say.
'Not at all. Say, do you think we might stop here and -'
DNT go farther
'No, Pippin, this is NOT the time for a meal. We must keep moving.'
'But wait - what was that?'
'This is a fair bit more dangerous than our first excursion.'
DNT talk to merry
DNT approach the three
You should continue searching the area for signs of the three half-orcs.
Defeat the enraged troll
You should resume searching the area for signs of the three half-orcs.
Instance: Deeper In
Continue searching
